result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Edward Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence Edward Johnson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Lawrence Edward Johnson in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with 14CM4036.   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Lawrence Edward Johnson not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot

Defendant Lawrence Edward Johnson in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Lawrence Edward Johnson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
